page.title: 07TENANT FARMER, STRENSHAM.
page.content: This good farmland seemed an infallible investment for a large {insurance company}in 1982. Today, farm bankruptcies are increasing with small tenant farmers most vulnerable. The comforting regularity of monthly milk income (90 cows to 150 acres) is now affected by cuts in{EEC quotas.}The 100 acres of wheat provides income once a year with quotas likely in the future. The farm supports three family members working long hours. The fourth works at the motorway services. The{M5}cuts the farm in half with a tunnel and cutting providing difficult access in bad weather. The farmer owns a good range of equipment, including his car and pickup. The farm has mains water, electricity and telephone and the nearby road systems are excellent. The local hunt is allowed on the land for fox and mink.
